hint.text:
The square of a number \('x'\) is \(x^2\)
Square root of \(x^2\) can be written as \(\sqrt{x^2}=x\)

solution.text:
\(_{{(j**m)*(k**n)*l}}_=_{j}_^_{m}_ \times _{k}_^_{n}_ \times _{l}_ \)
Observe carefully that the prime factors \(_{j}_\) and \(_{k}_\) exist in pairs.
The prime factor \(_{l}_\) does not have a pair.
Multiplying the number by \(_{l}_\), we get a square number,
\(_{{(j**m)*(k**n)*l}}_\times _{l}_=_{{(j**m)*(k**n)*(l**2)}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow _{{(j**m)*(k**n)*(l**2)}}_=_{j}_^_{m}_ \times _{k}_^_{n}_ \times _{l}_^2\)
Square root of the square number is :
\(\sqrt{_{{(j**m)*(k**n)*(l**2)}}_}=\sqrt{_{j}_^_{m}_ \times _{k}_^_{n}_ \times _{l}_^2}=_{j}_^_{{m/2}}_ \times _{k}_^_{{n/2}}_ \times _{l}_=_{{(j**(m/2))*(k**(n/2))*l}}_\)

content.text: Find the square root of the square number obtained.
